metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30565 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds write in Tab Groups in Google Chrome on Linux and ChromeOSprior to 92.0.4515.107 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to installa malicious extension to perform an out of bounds memory write via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
